alert.note: Alert for Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Galveston Island; Matagorda Islands (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued May 11 at 2:58PM CDT until May 11 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...High risk of rip currents and elevated seas and surf. * WHERE...Matagorda Islands, Brazoria Islands, Galveston Island and Bolivar Peninsula. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Hazardous swimming conditions along area beaches. Water levels peak around or just over 3 feet MLLW this afternoon during high tide along Gulf facing beaches. Minor coastal flooding will be possible at the lowest and more susceptible roadways during high tide today.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard and away from rocks, jetties, and piers. Remain alert to potential overwash on low lying coastal roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Galveston Island; Matagorda Islands
